Module src
Package BoardDrawingGame.logic

Class Utility

java.lang.Object
BoardDrawingGame.logic.Utility
public class Utility extends Object
The Utility class provides utility methods as an helper class for calculating points, checking game completion,and determining squares to draw on the UI in a Dots and Boxes game. This class is responsible for various game related calculations and checks the gameplay logic. It includes methods for calculating points, checking game completion conditions, and determining the squares to draw on the UI based on the moves made during the game.
Author:
Ali Kaan Uysal, Bas Van Dijk

  • Method Details

    • calculatePoint

      public int calculatePoint(String horizontalOrVertical, int horizontalIndex, int verticalIndex)
      Calculates the points for a specific move based on its position and orientation. The points are determined by the lines surrounding the move on the game board.
      Parameters:
      horizontalOrVertical - The orientation of the move ("H" for horizontal, "V" for vertical).
      horizontalIndex - The horizontal index of the move.
      verticalIndex - The vertical index of the move.
      Returns:
      The calculated points for the move.

    • calculatePointWithServerIndex

      public int calculatePointWithServerIndex(int serverIndex)
      Calculates points for a move based on its server index.
      Parameters:
      serverIndex - The server index of the move.
      Returns:
      The calculated points for the move.

    • calculatePointForTopHorizontalLines

      public int calculatePointForTopHorizontalLines(int horizontalIndex, int verticalIndex)
      This method calculates points for only top horizontal lines whose horizontal index is 0.
      Parameters:
      horizontalIndex - The horizontalIndex of the line.
      verticalIndex - The horizontalIndex of the line.
      Returns:
      int The calculated points for the move.

    • calculatePointForBottomHorizontalLines

      public int calculatePointForBottomHorizontalLines(int horizontalIndex, int verticalIndex)
      This method calculates points for only bottom horizontal lines whose horizontal index is 0.
      Parameters:
      horizontalIndex - The horizontalIndex of the line.
      verticalIndex - The horizontalIndex of the line.
      Returns:
      int The calculated points for the move.

    • calculatePointForLeftVerticalLines

      public int calculatePointForLeftVerticalLines(int horizontalIndex, int verticalIndex)
      This method calculates points for only left vertical lines whose vertical index is 0.
      Parameters:
      horizontalIndex - The horizontalIndex of the line.
      verticalIndex - The horizontalIndex of the line.
      Returns:
      int The calculated points for the move.

    • calculatePointForRightVerticalLines

      public int calculatePointForRightVerticalLines(int horizontalIndex, int verticalIndex)
      This method calculates points for only right vertical lines whose vertical index is 5.
      Parameters:
      horizontalIndex - The horizontalIndex of the line.
      verticalIndex - The horizontalIndex of the line.
      Returns:
      int The calculated points for the move.

      Returns:

    • isGameFinished

      public boolean isGameFinished()
      Checks if the game is finished by examining the state of horizontal and vertical lines on the board.
      Returns:
      true if the game is finished, false otherwise.

    • isOnlyThreePointLinesLeft

      public boolean isOnlyThreePointLinesLeft()
      Checks if there are only three-point lines left on the board.
      Returns:
      true if there are only three-point lines left, false otherwise.

    • getSquaresToDrawForUI

      public SquaresToDrawForUI getSquaresToDrawForUI(Line move)
      Gets the squares to draw for the GUI based on the move made.
      Parameters:
      move - The move made on the board.
      Returns:
      SquaresToDrawForUI object containing information about squares to draw and points earned.

    • areAdjacentDots

      public boolean areAdjacentDots(Dot startDot, Dot endDot)
      Checks if two dots are adjacent to each other.
      Parameters:
      startDot - The starting dot.
      endDot - The ending dot.
      Returns:
      true if the dots are adjacent, false otherwise.

    • getServerIndexToLine

      public Line getServerIndexToLine(int serverIndex)
      Converts a server index to a Line object representing the corresponding line on the game board.
      Parameters:
      serverIndex - The server index to be converted.
      Returns:
      A Line object representing the line corresponding to the server index.

      public Board copyBoard(Board board)
      Creates a deep copy of the given game board.
      Parameters:
      board - The original game board to be copied.
      Returns:
      A new Board object representing a deep copy of the original board.
